Cards.Title: Nucleotide
Cards.Description: basic unit or building block of DNA & RNA; composed of a sugar, a phosphate, and a nucleic acid

Cards.Title: Adenine
Cards.Description: nucleic acid found in both DNA & RNA; pairs with Thymine in DNA; pairs with Uracil in RNA

Cards.Title: Guanine
Cards.Description: nucleic acid found in both DNA & RNA; pairs with Cytosine

Cards.Title: Cytosine
Cards.Description: nucleic acid found in both DNA & RNA; pairs with Guanine

Cards.Title: hydrate
Cards.Description: a compound that contains water of hydration.

Cards.Title: molar volume
Cards.Description: the amount of space a mole of a substance takes up.

Cards.Title: catalyst
Cards.Description: A substance that increases the rate of reaction by lowering the activation-energy barrier; the catalyst is not used up in the reaction.

Cards.Title: reactant
Cards.Description: a substance present at the start of a reaction

Cards.Title: crystal
Cards.Description: particles are arranged in an orderly, repeating, three dimensional pattern called a crystal lattice

Cards.Title: amphoteric
Cards.Description: substance that can act as both an acid and a base

Cards.Title: molarity
Cards.Description: The number of moles of a solute dissolved in one liter of a solution.
